questions.question: What is the goal of the minmax algorithm in AI?

answers.c: To find the optimal move in a two-player zero-sum game
answers.d: To find the shortest path in a graph

questions.question: What is the minmax value of a node in a game tree?

answers.a: The maximum possible utility value that can be obtained from that node
answers.b: The minimum possible utility value that can be obtained from that node
answers.c: The average of the maximum and minimum utility values that can be obtained from that node
answers.d: The sum of the maximum and minimum utility values that can be obtained from that node

questions.question: What is alpha-beta pruning in the minmax algorithm?

answers.a: A technique for reducing the size of the game tree
answers.b: A technique for assigning weights to the edges of the game tree
answers.c: A technique for selecting the best move from the game tree
answers.d: A technique for improving the accuracy of the utility function

questions.question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of the minmax algorithm?

answers.a: It requires a complete game tree to be generated
answers.b: It only works for two-player zero-sum games
answers.c: It can be slow for large game trees
answers.d: It cannot handle incomplete information games

questions.question: What is the depth-limited minmax algorithm?

answers.a: A version of the minmax algorithm that limits the depth of the game tree
answers.b: A version of the minmax algorithm that assigns weights to the edges of the game tree
answers.c: A version of the minmax algorithm that uses a heuristic evaluation function
answers.d: A version of the minmax algorithm that works for incomplete information games

questions.question: What is the purpose of the evaluation function in the minmax algorithm?

answers.a: To assign weights to the edges of the game tree
answers.c: To determine the utility value of a node in the game tree
